name: James Hoffmann V60 recipe
short_description: An easy-to-follow recipe by James Hoffmann. [Watch the tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AI4ynXzkSQo).

steps.description: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60. Pour in grounds, create well in the middle.
Swirl brewer until the slurry is even.
Complete the first main pour till (0.6 x <final_water_amount>)g. in the next 30s.
Gently complete second main pour till <final_water_amount>g. in the next 30s.
Stir gently clockwise and anticlockwise to kick grounds from the sides
Gently swirl brewer to flatten coffee bed for even extraction

name: Scott Rao classic V60 recipe
short_description: Scott Rao's V60 recipe focuses on even extraction and a consistent brew. Scott Rao [recommends](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c0Qe_ASxfNM) using a plastic V60 to retain the heat of the brew and allows to manipulate the funnel during the brew without burning yourself.

steps.description: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60, Pour in grounds, flatten
Gently excavate to wet all the grounds
Gently stir to stop grounds from clinging to sides
Swirl V60 to flatten coffee bed for even brew
Drawdown should be complete within 3 minutes.

name: Lance Hedrick's ultimate flash brew
short_description: High extraction, low bitterness, and all delicacies of the beans in iced coffee. [Watch the tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qwvnQcojq9Q&)

steps.description: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60, Pour in grounds, flatten
Pour (0.375 x <final_water_amount>)g again and swirl gently. Wait until completely drained.
Add (0.25 x <final_water_amount>)g of ice and stir until cooled to 5-10°C

name: James Hoffmann iced V60 recipe
short_description: James Hoffmann's take on iced filter coffee. [Watch the tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PApBycDrPo0).

steps.description: Rinse filter above the sink to avoid heating the server. Pour in coffee grounds. Place (0.4 x <final_water_amount>)g of ice in the server. Place on the scale and zero it out.
Slowly pour till (0.6 x <final_water_amount>)g. of water.
Swrl the server to melt the ice. Pour over fresh ice cubes in the glass.

name: James Hoffmann V60 - One cup recipe
short_description: James Hoffmann's recipe for one-cup V60. [Watch the tutorial video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1oB1oDrDkHM).

steps.description: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60. Pour in grounds.

name: Tetsu Kasuya 4:6 Method
short_description: The 4:6 method gets its name by how the hot water is divided during the pouring stages—40% and 60%—which allows you to adjust the flavor and concentration of the coffee. Tetsu Kasuya, who created this technique won the 2016 World Brewers Cup Champion with it. [Read the tutorial](https://en.philocoffea.com/blogs/blog/coffee-brewing-method) to better understand how this method works. My advice is to try brewing the same beans and only adjust one parameter at time to see how it makes a real difference.

steps.description: Rinse filter & pre-heat V60. Pour in coffee grounds. Set on the scales and zero out.
Pour up to (<m2> x <final_water_amount>)g of water.
Pour up to (<m3> x <final_water_amount>)g of water.
Pour up to (<m4> x <final_water_amount>)g of water.
Pour up to (<m5> x <final_water_amount>)g of water.
